definition: to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
(conventional letter ending) words cannot fully express what is in my heart (idiom)
the idea is present before the first stroke of the brush, when the last stroke is placed the idea shines through
pinyin: yi4 cun2 bi3 xian1 , hua4 jin4 yi4 zai4

sentences.english: An end, often need entities for party fails to show words meaning of the poor.
sentences.chinese: 一種結局，常需存有惋惜方顯言盡意未窮的回味。

sentences.english: Pray for the Lion of Judah to capture his heart, mind and soul.
sentences.chinese: 願他爲猶大支派的獅子盡心盡意。

sentences.english: Repeatedly, the Bible says to "serve the Lord with all your heart.
sentences.chinese: 聖經上接二連三的要我們“盡心盡意的侍奉主”。

sentences.english: Words can't take expresses, but I hope you know how I love you.
sentences.chinese: 言語不能盡意，但你知道我愛你的深意。

sentences.english: Repeatedly, the Bible says to "serve the Lord with all your heart."
sentences.chinese: 聖經上接二連三的要我們“盡心盡意的侍奉主”。

definition: displaying fully/developing to the greatest extent
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to be successful in every endeavor
